Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet

package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet
Servlet 4.0 container implementation.

This package provides a full Servlet 4.0 (JSR 369) container for deploying and running Java web applications. It integrates with the Gumdrop HTTP server to handle servlet requests.

Key Components

  • Container - The main servlet container managing multiple web applications
  • Context - Represents a single web application (ServletContext)
  • Request - HTTP request implementation (HttpServletRequest)
  • Response - HTTP response implementation (HttpServletResponse)

Servlet 4.0 Features

  • HTTP/2 server push
  • Servlet mapping API
  • Default methods in listener interfaces
  • GenericFilter and HttpFilter
  • Trailer headers for chunked responses

Configuration Example


 <container id="mainContainer">
   <property name="contexts">
     <list>
       <context path="" root="web"/>
       <context path="/myapp" root="/var/webapps/myapp"/>
     </list>
   </property>
 </container>

 <server id="http" class="org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.ServletServer">
   <property name="port">8080</property>
   <property name="container" ref="#mainContainer"/>
 </server>

Web Application Deployment

Web applications can be deployed as:

  • Exploded directories with WEB-INF/web.xml
  • WAR files (automatically extracted)
  • Programmatic registration via ServletContainerInitializer

Session Management

Sessions are managed by the org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.session subpackage, with optional clustering support for session replication across multiple nodes.

JNDI Resources

The container provides a JNDI namespace for resource injection, implemented in the org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi subpackage.

Subpackages

  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.session - Session management and clustering
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jndi - JNDI resource binding and injection
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.jsp - JSP compilation support
  • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.servlet.manager - Management interface
Author:
Chris Burdess

    Description
    Container
    Container for a number of web application contexts.
    Context
    The application context represents the single point of contact for all servlets and associated data in the application.
    DefaultServlet
    Default servlet for a Web application.
    Description
    Interface implemented by servlet and filter definitions.
